lead_paragraph: ZipCap is testing a system for quantifying customers’ devotion at places like Beezy’s Cafe in Ypsilanti, Mich., and turning it into a monetizable asset.

headline.print_headline: A Start-Up That Makes Loans Based on Loyalty When Banks Will Not
headline.main: A Start-Up That Makes Loans Based on Loyalty When Banks Will Not

snippet: ZipCap is testing a system for quantifying customers’ devotion at places like Beezy’s Cafe in Ypsilanti, Mich., and turning it into a monetizable asset.
abstract: ZipCap, fledgling start-up in San Diego, offers small retailers access to low-interest loans financed by investors specifically focusing on helping a local economy; unique lending model, called 'loyalty capital,' calculates ability to pay loan back based on identifying set of regular customers willing to pledge to spend specific amount of money in fixed period of time.
